intro: Buphthalmum nutans, commonly known as the nodding eye of the desert, is a flowering plant native to southern Africa. It belongs to the family Asteraceae, characterized by its composite flower heads. The plant features a basal rosette of fleshy, succulent leaves that are covered in fine hairs. Its showy yellow flowers are arranged in a single head and bloom in late summer. Buphthalmum nutans is adapted to arid environments, with features that help it conserve water and withstand drought.
